resources.string: Man-made climate change poses the biggest threat to our existence. It is in everyone’s interest that we act now individually on a individual level to ensure a sustainable future. This application includes ten daily actions that would collectively have a good impact on the climate. Press “ACT” and collect points for each action that you have completed. If you have any questions,press the info button in the top right corner.

A normal shower gets rid of about 12 liters of water per minute. On average, a person shower for 13 minutes. Thus, get rid of 156 liters per shower. By going down to 5 minutes of showers, the average person will save 96 liters of water for each shower. In addition to the water savings, we also save energy used to pump and heat the water.

Plastic bags don’t biodegrade, they photodegrade. Which means that they break down into smaller and smaller bits. Moreover, a plastic bag can take up to 400 to 1000 years to break down. During that time, plastic particles contaminate the soil and waterways and are accidentally ingested by animals. On average, each human consumes 200 plastic bags each year and 90% of them are only used once. Register your ACT each day that you have brought your own bag rather than buying one and using it once.

Transportations accounts for one third of all CO2 emissions. 72% of that third is from road transport. For each time that you take an alternative means of transport rather than what you would usually do you can register that ACT.

Production of electricity brings large environmental impacts – The combustion of fossil fuels, nuclear waste and more. The consumption of electricity has more than tripled since the 1970’s and increased with 14% since the year 2000. For each day that you have turned off all the lights that you are not in your current state needed for, register an ACT.

A lot of products, especially food and vegetables have transported a long way to reach your nearest grocery store. In addition, some may be frozen or chilled (impacting the climate even more). To not impact this chain of transportation, we encourage you to buy locally produced products and goods. Each time you buy locally, you can register your ACT.

According to the World’s Wildlife Fund (WWF), beef accounts for 28 kilo CO2 equivalents per kilo food, shrimps 11, pork 4,8 and chicken 2,6. To have a positive affect on climate change, you should change your diet to be meatless. For each day that you do not consume meat, you can register your ACT.
By recycling you reduce the climate impact because the recycled goods is recovered and do not cause unnecessary CO2 emissions. When you recycle, you can register your ACT.

One way to reduce unnecessary waste and production is to having your own reusable and refillable water bottle and coffee cup. By going a day without using a disposable bottle or cup, you can register your ACT.

Many devices consume more or the same amount of electricity in standby than in use. To effectively decrease your consumption of, you should unplug all devices that are not in use. By doing so for one day, you can register your ACT.

Clothes demands large resources to produce. They go through numerous of production steps and countries before being completed. It takes a lot of chemicals, water and energy to fibers. Moreover, on average, a third of all clothes bought never gets used and we throw away eight kilos worth of clothes each year. For each day passed without buying any unnecessary clothing you can register your ACT.

ACTs on climate change can\'t wait! Register and collect your points.
